My dear wife of my heart  
Porto Alegre, December 15, 1835.

I have already received two of yours, and from the delight that both have caused me, you can judge by the feelings you experience when you receive mine. I had been quite distressed until a few days ago, thinking that well-directed intrigues had caused distrust among ours; however, seeing the contrary, that we are firmly moving forward in the good of our Province, joy has been reborn in my heart. I now live content, and the young ladies do not leave me troubled; poor things, they waste their time, because I pay no heed to them and consequently, all say there is no girl more fortunate than you, that I am the example of married men, and with that I make the state desirable. And how about that? See how much my behavior is worth and how happy you are possessing a husband who is young, handsome, well-made, and faithful. Where does one find so much combined? Indeed, in this century it is a phenomenon, a marvel, etc., etc.

Hugs to our children, regards to all our people, and farewell until the 23rd of this month, God willing; save me something.  
Your husband of the heart, Almeida.

To Mrs. Bernardina Barcelos de Almeida.  
Pelotas.
